project.teaser: The EuroGEOSec project (led by ARMINES) brings together a European consortium built from the core group of the team involved in the H2020 e-shape (EuroGEO Showcases: Applications powered by Europe) project and will collaborate with the Joint Research Centre Knowledge Center on...
project.objective: The EuroGEOSec project (led by ARMINES) brings together a European consortium built from the core group of the team involved in the H2020 e-shape (EuroGEO Showcases: Applications powered by Europe) project and will collaborate with the Joint Research Centre Knowledge Center on Earth Observation (JRC-KCEO) to support the EuroGEO vision and to prepare the transition of the EuroGEO initiative into a sustainable endeavour, by setting-up a EuroGEO secretariat. The overarching goal of the EuroGEOSec project is to support the coordination of the EuroGEO initiative and develop a sustainability plan guiding its long-term operation. This will be achieved by establishing the EuroGEO Secretariat with the mission to (i) strengthen GEO-related coordination mechanisms at European and national levels, (ii) support increased innovation, space application development and reinforcement of the European space data ecosystem concept; (iii) foster international cooperation to help stimulate the market and promote European technology and services; (iv) contribute to the European Green Deal objectives and the European strategy for data (EU Data Spaces) by further deploying and exploiting the use of EO towards a strengthened Global Earth Observation System of Systems (GEOSS). The project delivers the definition, set-up, operation and ramp-up of the EuroGEO Secretariat serving the EuroGEO initiative and its ecosystem of actors, and developing support services and a sustainability strategy that will inform the long-term operation of the EuroGEO initiative. Project url website: www.eurogeosec.eu
project.title: Establishing the EuroGEO Secretariat to support the EuroGEO initiative
project.keywords: EuroGEO, GEO, environmental observations, EU policy contributions, priorisation of R&I funding, EuroGEO sustainability & legal, business models, combining, cooperating and coordinating

result.title: Report on meetings with Industry - first round (6 workshops)
result.description: T2.4 - This deliverable will report on the first round of meetings between projects and EO or non-EO industries performed from M1 to M12 and on `key outcomes from the annual workshop to be organized to federate the established connection and promote the community engagement.

result.title: Communication and Dissemination Strategy
result.description: T5.1 - Report outlining the major axes of the communication and dissemination strategy. Definition of target audiences, key messages, tools and activities.

result.title: Inventory of existing resources and infrastructures usable by the Eurogeo Community for the two thematic domains selected as pilot domains
result.description: "T2.5 - The proposal mentions that ""Extreme events and Climate will be used as pilot domains to develop engagements and identify the resources and methodology of work."" Reference data, services, standards, softwares, platform relevant to these domains will be identified outside of a desk study and a survey will be made contacting the different stakeholders the project wants to engage with to identify interest, further resources, projects and plans related to the pilot domains. As far as possible, a methodology to apply the approach to other domains will be suggested."

result.title: Report on Communication and Dissemination Activities - interim version
result.description: T5.2 - Mid-term reporting on communication and dissemination activities for the first 12 months, including their scope, targets and impact.

result.title: EuroGEO Secretariat Support to Market Development Process
result.description: T3.3 - This deliverable will lay out the definition of the main target communities, identify the knowledge to capitalise such as policy aspects and the tools (eoWIKI and eoMALL) to support outreach.

result.title: Website
result.description: T5.1 - Website, aiming at sustaining the interest of the existing audience by presenting attractive content for visitors. The website provides up-to-date information on EuroGEO related events, actions, social media, outcomes of events and other documents of interest.

result.title: Report on liaison meetings - partnerships, networks and projects - first meeting
result.description: T2.3 - This Deliverable will report on the first meeting with HE partnerships, networks and projects and will serve for view exchange on data and service production and detect specific needs to bring them to contribute to EUROGEO. It will scope the activity and define the survey.

result.title: EuroGEO Secretariat Support to Innovation Processes
result.description: T3.2 - This report will lay out the tools and processes deployed to support innovation through the EuroGEO Secretariat.

result.title: Report on workshops with Entrusted entities, European bodies - first version
result.description: T2.6 - This Deliverable will report on the first round of workshops with the EEEs and European Bodies serving as as a view of exchange on capabilities between different EuroGEO projects and EU entities.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
